topics.body:
>works really hard on writing overarching story for the Sims forums

>posts seven chapters

>0 replies

>some twelve year old kid writes one chapter without spell check

>twenty replies

>mfw

!http://weknowmemes.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/am-i-out-of-touch-no-its-the-children-who-are-wrong.jpg!

(Why do people look down on greentext? It's such an easy way to communicate!)

All joking aside, I know the feeling. But then again, that's just a consequence of me being a not-so-good writer.

"@Silent_Witness":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e54dae6368722ebe941e00#post_54e54dae6368722ebe941e00

Literally the minute I typed this, I got one reply.

It was just someone advertising their _own_ story, but I'll take it.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e54ded63687222e39a0b00#post_54e54ded63687222e39a0b00
I have to admit I'm hesitant to do something like that. I realize that promoting the things you write is important if you want views, but at the same time I don't want to seem too desperate (since it drives people away). And you have to do it at the right place and time (I have no sense of timing).
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

Wat?
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
Yo; I just thought of something: if my boss wants to fire me, but chose not to because literally not another person at work knows how to do anything I do that means my long term job security if pretty damn high.  He could get easily replace most of the other workers cause the majority of them are unskilled labor, but me he's fucked if he fires me without a replacement.

I feel a lot better.
